Section.name: S_4498
Section.title: PATHOLOGIC STAGE CLASSIFICATION (pTNM, AJCC 8th Edition) (Note G)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_57948
DisplayedItem.title: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

Property.name: p_rptTxt_57948_1
Property.val: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

ListItem.name: LI_327827
ListItem.title: pT not assigned (cannot be determined based on available pathological information)

ListItem.name: LI_4501
ListItem.title: pT0: No evidence of primary tumor

DisplayedItem.name: DI_378857
DisplayedItem.title: # CAP Author's Note: In situ carcinoma (pTis) is typically reserved for high grade dysplasia with complex architecture (typically papillary or tubulopapillary, eg intracystic papillary carcinoma) confined to the epithelial layer by intact basement membrane. The term high grade dysplasia is likely preferable for most lesions confined by intact basement membrane.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_38725
DisplayedItem.title: pT1: Tumor invades the lamina propria or muscular layer

ListItem.name: LI_4505
ListItem.title: pT1b: Tumor invades the muscular layer

DisplayedItem.name: DI_51517
DisplayedItem.title: pT2: Tumor invades the perimuscular connective tissue on the peritoneal side, without involvement of the serosa (visceral peritoneum) or tumor invades the perimuscular connective tissue on the hepatic side, with no extension into the liver

ListItem.name: LI_37865
ListItem.title: pT2a: Tumor invades the perimuscular connective tissue on the peritoneal side, without involvement of the serosa (visceral peritoneum)

ListItem.name: LI_37866
ListItem.title: pT2b: Tumor invades the perimuscular connective tissue on the hepatic side, with no extension into the liver

ListItem.name: LI_4507
ListItem.title: pT3: Tumor perforates the serosa (visceral peritoneum) and / or directly invades the liver and / or one other adjacent organ or structure, such as the stomach, duodenum, colon, pancreas, omentum or extrahepatic bile ducts

ListItem.name: LI_4508
ListItem.title: pT4: Tumor invades the main portal vein or hepatic artery or invades two or more extrahepatic organs or structures
